lead_paragraph: The Iraqis are having trouble moving supplies to their troops on battlefields, and a planned offensive against the Islamic State’s stronghold will probably have to wait.

byline.contributor: Falih Hassan contributed reporting from Baghdad.
byline.original: By MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT and ERIC SCHMITT

headline.print_headline: Planned Attack to Retake Mosul Is Facing a Delay
headline.main: Iraqi Army Seen as Ill Equipped to Retake Mosul From ISIS, Despite U.S. Aid

snippet: The Iraqis are having trouble moving supplies to their troops on battlefields, and a planned offensive against the Islamic State’s stronghold will probably have to wait.
abstract: Iraqi army's plan to retake city of Mosul from Islamic State is facing months-long delay, despite American efforts to support exhausted defenses; problems with equipment and supply chain, summer heat, impending fasts during month of Ramadan and parallel effort to retake Falluja are among elements complicating plans.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
